punchlineSameWin.1: everyone bet on the right horse...

punchlineSameLose.1: no one bet on the right horse...

EventResults.gainInfo: In case of a win, your initial stake is not included in the final winnings :)
punchlineWin: We know you're dying to get your Chouquettes back, but try to be patient a little longer before doing something silly...
We invite you to go and claim what's owed to you from the person(s) involved, just try to stay peaceful...
If the person(s) involved don't settle their debts, you officially have the right to organize a face-off to resolve the dispute...
Good things come to those who wait, but when in doubt, you can always go and put some pressure on the person(s) involved...
The use of force is not encouraged by the staff during negotiations...
punchlineLose: Hurry up and settle your debts before something bad happens...
A rumor has it that a vendetta is being planned if you don't pay your debts quickly...
Beware, Chouquette is serious, and someone who doesn't get what's owed can become dangerous...
Quick, pay your debts before someone makes you pay even more...
A little bird told me someone is about to make you pay your debts if you don't settle them quickly...

Question1.title: How does a bet work?

BetParagraph.0: Prior to the event, users can bet on the event's outcome.
BetParagraph.1: Everyone can stake between 1 and 10 Chouquette(s).
BetParagraph.title: Betting

CloseParagraph.0: Once the event's date has passed, bets are closed. Users must wait for the organizer to define the winning proposition.
CloseParagraph.1: Users can come back later to see the results.
CloseParagraph.title: Closed event

ResultParagraph.0: Each bettor can see if they won or owe Chouquettes (and especially, to whom).
ResultParagraph.title: Results

Question1.gainInfo: In case of a win, your initial stake is not included in the final winnings :)

definitionParagraph.0: Each bettor chooses a number of Chouquettes (between 1 and 10) to bet on a proposition.
definitionParagraph.1: At the end of the bet, the event's author defines the winning proposition by closing the bets.
definitionParagraph.2: Then, we sum up the Chouquettes bet on a losing choice.
definitionParagraph.title: Defining the winnings

example.0: We have 4 bettors: CÃ©dric, Martine, Fabrice, and Ã‰dith.
example.1: CÃ©dric and Ã‰dith bet 8 and 2 Chouquettes on the winning choice.
example.2: Martine and Fabrice bet 4 and 4 Chouquettes on one of the losing choices.
example.3: We sum up the Chouquettes bet on the losers âžœ Â« A Â» = 8
example.4: We will then divide the 8 Chouquettes between CÃ©dric and Fabrice.
example.5: CÃ©dric bet for 80% (8/10) of the total Chouquettes bet on the winner. Ã‰dith 20% (2/10).
example.6: CÃ©dric therefore takes 80% of the 8 Chouquettes which is 6.4 Chouquettes.
example.7: Ã‰dith, on the other hand, takes 20% of the 8 Chouquettes which is 1.6 Chouquette.
example.title: Example

dispatchParagraph.0: For the distribution, we take the amount bet by each loser and distribute it based on the winnings of each winner.
dispatchParagraph.title: Who gives to whom?

example.0: Martine will give her 4 Chouquettes to the first winner, CÃ©dric.
example.1: CÃ©dric will be short 2.4 Chouquettes to complete his winnings, which will be provided by Fabrice.
example.2: The last 1.6 Chouquettes from Fabrice will then be given to the second winner, Ã‰dith.
